session_summary.objective: Analyze the updated DripSim repository structure and .gitignore, and support the next steps for Blender modeling and Unity integration for the 3D farm simulator focused on irrigated fruit farming (mango and grape) in the sub-médio São Francisco region.

activities.description: Analyzed the updated .gitignore (artifact_id: fb26a437-51af-4ebd-b320-d81fe14f9497), which now ignores Rider configurations (**/.idea/*) with exceptions for codeStyles and inspectionProfiles, and folder_content.txt. Confirmed it correctly prevents version control of unnecessary IDE and temporary files while maintaining shared code style settings.

Reviewed the updated directory structure from directory_tree.txt, noting new subfolders dripsim_assets/referencias (for reference images) and dripsim_docs/memorias (for session memory files). Confirmed dripsim_game/Assets remains ready for prefabs and scripts, with standard Unity folders (Library, ProjectSettings) correctly ignored by .gitignore.

Suggested prioritizing low and medium complexity props (e.g., dry soil, rocks, dripper) for Blender modeling, with .blend files in dripsim_assets/models and .fbx exports to dripsim_game/Assets/Prefabs. Provided guidance for integrating models with PlayerController.cs, IrrigationSystem.cs, and PlantSystem.cs in SampleScene.unity, and committing to GitHub (https://github.com/valdomiromorais/dripsim.git).

next_steps: Model props in Blender (e.g., dripper, dry soil, rocks) and save .blend files in dripsim_assets/models, exporting as .fbx to dripsim_game/Assets/Prefabs.
Create semi-arid textures (e.g., solo_seco.png) in dripsim_assets/textures for terrain in SampleScene.unity using URP shaders.
Integrate PlayerController.cs, IrrigationSystem.cs, and PlantSystem.cs in SampleScene.unity with new prefabs for testing movement, irrigation, and planting.
Commit new models, textures, and prefabs to the GitHub repository.
Consider adding a README in dripsim_docs/memorias to list session memory files.
